Detailed Description

Subclass to synchronize human player actions.

This class is used to implement the human moves. It relies on a bit of threading hacking and should not be modified as minor changes can break the human input functions.

Definition at line 23 of file Display.java.

Member Function Documentation

int Display.Display.HumanBlocker.getMove (  ) 

Request a move selection from active human player.

Blocks until the human has chosen a move, then returns that move. Calling this function more than once per HumanBlocker will cause an IllegalStateException.

Returns:
The move chosen by the human.
